title: RockBell
author: RockBell
content: I got a call today thank God for true caller already saw the name fraudster, I smiled and spoke calmly, and he told me that opay is currently under maintenance that they are going to be sending me OTP I should call it out for him all was his intention was to login to my account and swipe my account most people have switched from banks to opay wallet and many more. Please all of us operating opay should be alert and also try to inform our loved ones about this information. Just that the painful aspect of it is that a lot of people¬† have falling victim. All this fraudsters are trying by all means to take advantage of innocent¬† people.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: This reminds me of my niece that her Facebook was got hacked recently, it was through OTP she sent to the hacker.Some years ago, I got a call from a scammer, telling me something like that, asking me for my bank account details. I knew it was a scam already and I bother not to go further with him.Recently, some weeks or days ago, I got a call. Exactly the same type of scam. Telling me they are requesting for only FCMB bank account or so, that if I do not have FCMB account, that I can use my relative bank account. Telling me about Tinubu (our next president) grant or something.Recently, some days ago, my mom got similar message, but through our previous conversations, she has understood already it was a scam. Many scam like that my dad do show me. One even a name that is almost the same with the bank he is using. He almost fought with me that it could be real, but I still told him they are scammers. He later knew I was right. Anyone's account can be hacked through OTP given to scammers, thinking you gave it to an official worker of the bank that you are using. Any thing that requires OTP for authentication, it can be used by scammers to take over your account and do whatever they like before you gain control back.Surprisingly, bank official has never called me before, but people are falling for this scam when bank officials are not calling except they are suspecting something wrong with your account and that is if you are a very rich person that the bank can not afford to lose.

comments.author: Yawa2020
comments.body: But sha I hear say dem dey use jazz if not how person go just call you for OTP and you will call it the cod for them? Banks and all Fintechs have warned several times that they will never request OTP from a customer for whatsoever reason. I don't know why our people still dey fall for that one again.The day wey one call me ehh I waste his airtime by making the conversation longer and ask him to resend the OTP. After re-send I will come up with another excuse again until the code expires and continue like that until the werey con realizes and insult my father and end up the call Forget about bad leadership in this country, we the citizens are part of the problems too.

They normally come up with interesting offer(money matter) wey go make you to do their biddings if you no know. It takes exposure of things wey don happen and the things wey you don hear go fit make you not to fall victim of their yeye scam. Na why be sae if you find out their ways of operation, you inform your family and friends about am so that them no go fall victim of am easily.

That's how it works most time l these scammers or fraudsters tend to use cases where the victim will be scared that they are about to lose something important to them and out of that fear they would be willing to handout whatever the scammer demands from them and that includes OTP. I have experienced something like this, it was when I went to open my bank and account and to also generate my BVN. On the supposed day the bank had issues and couldn't complete mine so they asked me to return back the in two days time on getting there I received a call while they where attending to me, the called claimed that he (it was a masculine voice) works for the bank and that they would be needing my account number and my bvn is that they can complete my account creation, I informed the man attending to me and he confirmed that the person I just spoke with is a scammer. Okay now, Imagine if this had happen to someone else?¬† someone that's still new to the system?

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Just as the saying goes information is powerful, it is nice you updated us with this unfolding events goig on in our country. The nefarious act of these nature is getting out of hand. One needs to be extremely careful and alert as not to fall victim or prey of these crooks. They are everywhere but I still wonder how they get to know that one is an account holder of the platform they are targeting and they get your details and comfortably call you telling you that they are from the customer care service of your service provider wanting you to cooperate with them so that they could help restore your account but what baffles me most is that they mostly call at night to carry out their act so that before their victim could raise an alarm they are already done with their act. One needs to be careful these days on activities pertaining to details being released as scammers are on the spree to hack people's funds.

comments.body: As people dey chuk mouth for the scam types, make I follow put mouth.E get one of my guys dem hack him account, the guy dey enlightened, so I surprised how dem use hack him account. Because my Facebook account I create am around 2010 and nothing don ever happen to the account. I just dey person wey I sabi well well, I no know say them hack him account. The person come tell me say him Facebook dey get issues that Facebook say make dem tell their Facebook friend to use recover their account. Make I send my number so that dem go drop code. comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: When I saw that OPAY was gaining popularity and becoming the go-to app for the fastest, surest and safest transactions, I knew it was only a matter of time before the people of the underworld lash on to it to defraud unsuspecting customers. Soo, when I first heard about people who disguise as OPAY agents to call and send OTP and even of a small scall business woman who fell prey to them, I was mad because in this age and time when information is flying all over the place, I do not expect anyone to fall for it. Anyways make all of us just dey very careful shall. Download Truecaller, that app na lifesaver.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: The same thing happened to last month, I saw an advertisement on PAGA POS and the equipment that follow the purchasing of the device was attracted, I pm the page and they send me a WhatsApp number to follow up the registration process which I did. The first instruction was to download PAGA Agent¬† App from Google Play. Which I did, then I have to deposit 45k and screenshot the amount that is inside the account and snt to them with the username to begin the registration. Before I know I got OTP and he said I should send him the code to unlock the POS, I said no, the POS must be open in my front and when I tried to login to my account, PAGA company suspended the account for like 30 minutes because of over attempt login without success. I became to notice that they were trying to hack my account and took away with the money but PAGA was also wise enough to locked the account for over attempt. And I told him he that, "He was just trying to hack my account, it wouldn't work" and this guys didn't allowed the 30 minutes suspension to end as the 30 minutes ends I trying to login another 30 minutes again for about 5 times and I over smart them and login and transfered the money to my first bank account, and told them that they failed band the guys accepted it. So be careful with your OTP.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: It is same story everytime. People should be wise enough to know not to call out personal information to any one not known over the phone. Even if the person is known, security questions to ascertain the how and why is relevant inorder not to fall victims to scammers. It's just a normal precaution. I am still very much surprised that people still fall prey to this old scam logic.

Naso one lady call am con de tell am d same thing wey dem tell you say dem de do maintenance so dem go send am OTP make him forward am give dem. Thats how he sent dem the code and minutes later dem jus clear him account. I pity the guy sef as him call me con de tell me about am, he said he didn‚Äôt even suspect anything and he thought they are actually opay staffs.
